column4: My motd has been replaced with the original text. I am trying to figure out, which program did it. Someone got an idea, where to look?
sometimes a newly installed program will overwrite files, but it generally asks you
thanks. I suspect the normal updates to be the bad guy. Google is not a big help, or I am searching with the wrong terms. I am going to grep my whole file system now. *annoyed*
They took away my wonderful colored ASCII art *g*
if you redo a good one i wouldnt mind seeing it...
No, I am not that good *G* It's just a 'figlet <hostname>' in rainbow colors
If you don't know already, check out mplayer's ASCII video out filter.
i havent seen it... ill take a look... one thing you could do is write protect the /etc/motd file so it can't be overwritten...
I thought of write protection already, but feared some problems might occur. I might just have found the script. (/etc/{init.d/bootmisc.sh,rcS.d/S55bootmisc.sh}
If I only would remember grep and find syntax. Always gotta read the man pages
HAHA same here... you could always copy the motd you make into your home directory and then add a cron job to restore it once a day...
No way LOL. I want to resolve this once and for all at the root of the evil. The scripts I found, do a cat >> /var/run/motd, so I keep looking
I guess, the least people use Ubuntu at the console reguraily?
How sure are you about making motd read only causing no harm later? (The updater might crash or whatever?)
yeah most people are gui nowadays... it just doesnt seem like linux with a gui...
But it would be a cheap solution...
the updater *should* write an error to the log file about overwriting that file...
and then just continue
dpkg could be it, right?
you know its possible... but i cant seem to recall anything that updates those files...
grep "motd" /var/lib/dpkg/info/base-files.postinst
looks like that is the culprit and it looks like it overwrote my motd file as well... time to turn off updates
mine was moved to /etc/motd.old
i have no .old ... odd. I turned off autoupdates, but I should keep updating, i guess. Changed the template motd and will wait, so I will known, when it happens again.
